biography:
🎯 Co-founder & COO of @trysugar
⚡ Sharing candid hits & misses of building a winning brand from scratch | @ironmantri athlete | full-time dad
👇 TEDx

latestIgtvVideos.caption:
Why does it always feel like there's never enough time? That we're always running behind the clock.

It's probably because...
There actually isn't enough time.

For us to do all the things we love doing.
For as long as we would like. 

Which is why 'compartmentalization' is so important. The ability to shut out all distractions and other work except for what lies in front of you.

Right there.
At that very moment. 

🎯🎯🎯

#thoughts #lifequotes #timeflies #life #lifelesson #time #motivational #motivationalspeech #goodadvice #motivational_quotes #thoughtoftheday #deepthoughts #latenightthoughts #positivethoughts #lessonslearned #thoughtsbecomethings #motivationalvideo #familytime #motivationalquotes #foodforthought #positivethought #advice #lifeisgood #foods4thought #qualitytime

Two things that you've probably heard by now but it's a good time to add a friendly reminder 👇

ONE.

Turns out the producers of the show decided to churn out a bonus episode of @sharktank.india after seeing the insane response to Season 1 🤩

New set. New pitches. New dresses! Drops only on the Sony Liv app at 9 pm today.

TWO.

This, you already know.

"SUGAR Cosmetics transferproof hai" 😅

🔥@trysugar 🔥

p.s. Also, do check out @sippline_india to know more about the product Sippline that was showcased in this segment ✨

#sharktankindia #sharktank #investors #businessowner #startup #businessmindset #businessideas #businesstips #smallbusiness #businessman #businessgrowth #business #pitch #businessstrategy #businesswomen #businessopportunity #businesspassion #businessowners #startuplife #investor #startups #businessgoals #businesscoaching #businesswoman #onlinebusiness #entrepreneurship #startupbusiness #businesslife #businesscoach #realitytv

The fact is that most of us get into the ring assuming that the only way to win is to knock the opponent out. But life's not a boxing match.

What if the rules of the game are different from what we've always imagined it to be. 

What if the winner is the one who can take the most number of punches - the one who gets knocked down the maximum number of times...

And still stands up to fight again.

What if there's one version of life where the winner is the one who just doesn't give up.

Think about it.

And then maybe... there can be many winners in a world where everyone competes with themselves first. And then with the world around them.

I think we put too much emphasis on timing the market and being at the right place at the right time because it's easier for us to believe that someone got lucky with their timing. 

But here's what nobody talks about.

While it's tough to predict and "time the market" - it is a choice to keep playing the game. To keep managing the physical and emotional fatigue till the time, stars and moon and whatever else you believe in - align.

And then you will have the world will believe, that you too - have just "timed the market."

✨✨✨

Much more of such free-flowing banter for your listening from this no-holds-barred podcast that @vineetasng and I recorded with the unstoppable @rajshamani a few months back. Go check it out! 

...

latestPosts.caption:
Ever since we associated with Shark Tank India back in 2021, the single-most common question every one from my parents to my friends to my well-wishers asked me was this - "So when are you going to be on Shark Tank?"

Beyaaaaaarrrrr 😅🤦🏽‍♂️🙈

But well, sometimes random luck shines, stars align and an out-of-the-blue maverick opportunity opens up to plonk you right in the center of the tank with the ornate set looking intimidating and the sharks peering right through you. 

Well, sometimes - it's just "Go" time. 
𝘈𝘱𝘯𝘢 𝘛𝘪𝘮𝘦 𝘈𝘢𝘺𝘦𝘨𝘢.

10pm tonight (10/03) on Sony Entertainment Television and the SonyLIV App.

...

#startuplife #startupindia #startups #sweetdreams #dreamscometrue✨ #realitytv #startupgrind #dreams #startupstory #television #realityshow #sharktank #reality #flashback #bigdreams #startupbusiness #createyourreality #dreamscometrue #flashbacks #followyourdreams #flashbackfriday #manifestyourdreams #startup

Two images. 10 years apart. And here's the backstory of the one you see on the screen 👇

The one from 2012.

When an online publication asked us for a photo of the founders to accompany their story and we didn’t have any, we did what most of us do when we don’t have what it takes, but still don’t want to miss an opportunity.

Jugaad! 😇

STEP ONE: BRANDING IS EVERYTHING!

Needed a background with our logo but didn't have a poster ready so the next best thing? Projected a slide from our fund-raising deck to the TV in our living room. So far so good 🤞

STEP TWO: PROPS ARE (ALSO) EVERYTHING!

After narrowing down the list to a beauty box, pink ribbon and coffee mug - much to my relief at that time, Vineeta agreed to hold the box + pink ribbon and let me have the coffee mug which I seem to be holding on to dear life with my platypus claws 👀

STEP THREE: PLAY IT COOL

Nope, not possible. I still remember how long we debated over how close/apart we should stand. Far apart enough to not seem too casual or couple-y. Close enough to seem like a pair that can work together to build something of value. Go figure! 🙈

...

Earlier this year, in 2022 - we were in the middle of a photoshoot when suddenly I could see a screen, some props - yes, also a coffee mug. 

And we just had to recreate this.

🌟🌟🌟

This month as we complete a decade of many adventures and misadventures, we’re just very grateful to everyone who has encouraged us to keep building and fearlessly chase a big dream.

It took a while to earn our right to sit at the table.
It's time now - to play and win. 

'𝘈𝘢𝘳𝘢𝘮𝘣𝘪𝘬𝘢𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘢𝘭𝘢' 🔥

...

@vineetasng 
@kaushikmkj

latestPosts.caption:
Two of my favourite brands in the same frame. Finally 🖤

Mad rush at the Nike After Dark Tour expo in Mumbai over the past two days. Music. Mood. Coffee. Basically, the works.

But what else do you expect when ~5000 women
Rise as one to sign up for India’s first and largest
All-women 10K run - that takes places later today.

Once the sun sets. Once the night stretches.
Once the road makes way for the ones who choose.
To chase the best version of who they are.
Bold and Free.

SUGAR Cosmetics x Nike

@trysugar 
@nikerunning 
@riseindia 

#AfterDarkTour 
#NikeWomen

latestPosts.caption:
Sometimes in the journey of creating a product, you end up creating much more than that. Some explorations take you down a rabbit hole where a gush of new market trends, consumer preferences and product formulations hit you like a ton of bricks. 

And then suddenly, you are not just creating a product 
But a whole new version of yourself. 
The DNA stretches, uncomfortably so at times, 
Till the stretch begins to feel native 
And you forget what the past looked like. 

Maybe that’s why stretch marks are the medal of honour 
That any growth journey has to show. 

Back in 2017, sales of the then newly-launched 
Ace of Face Foundation Stick exploded 
Thanks to its unique form-factor, 22 inclusive shades 
And a lightweight creamy-matter texture. 

After 8 years, it is still the 2nd-largest selling range 
For the brand - but earlier this year
It was this very fact that started making us nervous.

History is proof that brands that have banked 
On milking one single success to last more than a decade 
Without investing the effort to innovate 
Have met with a reality check.

Kodak led film cameras till digital cameras took over.
Nokia led mobile phones till smartphones took over.

While Blockbuster stuck to physical DVD rentals.
Netflix pivoted to become a streaming giant.

This is us, then. 

Wrestling ourselves out of our comfort zone.
To create the all-new Ace Of Face “Dewy” Foundation.
Yes, it moisturizes for up to 40 hrs and lasts 18+ hrs
Yes, Boasts of 5% Niacinamide and Vegan Collagen
Yes, I can go on to celebrate the list of accolades
Of this path-breaking product...

But right now, all I feel like doing 
Is celebrating how the making of this product
Has pushed, pulled and shaped my team, 
This company, our partners - and of course, me. 

I hope you get to try out this labour of love soon.
And once you do, please do share feedback.
So we can continue to live up to the promise
Of learning, growing and moving forward on our journey
Of bringing world-class beauty products
To the fastest-growing beauty market in the world.

Just “Dewy”-t ✅

@trysugar 
@vineetasng 
@kaushikmkj

latestPosts.caption:
I first met Vivek 17 years ago when he interviewed me on campus for a summer internship at Bain & Company. Given how “summers” are usually hyped as a high-stakes, tension-filled melee of insecure alphas and wannabe alphas trying to land the next pedigree logo on their CVs, I was sleepless and on the edge - to say the least.

Vivek was my first interview early in the morning
And it was everything that I had NOT imagined it to be. 

Far from the boisterous bravado of most recruiters, 
His calm and disarming demeanour 
Immediately put me at ease. 

And it was this confidence that I carried as my shield 
Throughout a day full of a range of emotions
Till I landed my (at-that-point-in-time) dream internship. 

Fast-forward to earlier this month and voila! 
Vineeta and I were so privileged to host him at our office 
As he graciously made time to speak with us 
And some of our team members. 

Sharing below some of the brilliant things he said 
That are still swirling in my mind:

𝐓𝐨 𝐕𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐭𝐚 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐞:

“You need to define success as what it means to you.
And not what other people expect of you.”

𝐓𝐨 𝐚 𝐣𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐨𝐫 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐠𝐮𝐞:

“Your career is too important to be outsourced 
To the company you are working for.
Take initiative and write your own story.”

𝐓𝐨 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐨𝐫 𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩:

“Be less of a mentor and more of a sponsor
An advocate, an ally, a coach - we need more of that.”

If you have not read his book “HeadStart” 
I strongly recommend you pick this up. 

There is a reason why this is rated 4.7 on Amazon 
With over 200 reviews - it’s an investment that will change 
The way you build and thrive in modern workplaces. 

Thanks for the inspiration @vivek.gambhir ✨

latestPosts.caption:
Weekends are not for relaxing, there I said it. But before you cancel me, hear me out for a minute. Have you ever wondered how the weekend flew by so quickly on a Sunday evening?

“Man, where did the weekend go?” 🥲

You are not alone.
Happens to me as well, sometimes.

And that’s when I realise that when you spend 
Most of your weekdays pushing out 
Some of the things that you want to do
Or need to do or feel guilty of not doing 
To the same two days of Saturday and Sunday
Then our weekends end up looking pretty packed 
Most of the times. Which is why…

Weekends are not for relaxing.

There is that book that I need to finish.
The kids need a wicket-keeper while playing cricket.
Have to book tickets for my parents’ upcoming visit.
Call banking support to ask about the new charge.
The 5 km run is best done early but if I can wake up.
Those pesky emails that accumulate over the week.
Oh yes, haircut– have to book on UC.
Movie plan discussions in some WhatsApp group.
Kids have a play date. Shoot, it’s our turn to host.
A friend who has started up needs some advice.
There is the RWA Society meet - nope, not going.
See that video I’d saved on how 360 cameras work.
Guest room AC needs cleaning before parents arrive.
I really must finish that book this weekend 😭

So yeah, maybe you don’t need to hear it…
But weekends are not for relaxing.

The discipline that gets us through weekdays
Is just as—if not more—important on weekends.

Because on weekends, your commitment
Isn’t to your organization or manager, but to yourself.
And only when you carve out time — relentlessly
For what you want and need to do,
Do you start glimpsing that elusive “work-life balance”

Most don’t realize that balance isn’t passive rest
It’s being grateful for a full life.
And that won’t happen unless you fight for it.

So now that you read this far
And you still have half of Sunday left
Question is - what are you going to do? 

🙂🙃🙂

p.s. Photos from a weekend flamingo sighting trek. Pic 5 is us sulking when we learnt that the same trek was available in the afternoon but Mama booked us for 7 AM. Pic 6 is me scoring camouflage points 😂

latestPosts.caption:
Whatever I am today has largely been shaped by the 3 (+1) women who I have had the privilege of spending different phases of my life with:

🔸My Sister:
The one I probably fought most with while growing up
But also the one whose fight inspires me the most 

🔸My Mother:
Who taught me how to fight for what I believed in
No matter how hard or biased the conditions are

🔸My Better Half:
Who gives me perspective on which fights 
Are worth fighting and which are best to walk away from 

🔸And lest I forget, my MIL:
Who delightfully takes my side in every fight
And with whom I never dare pick a fight 😅

The truth is - there’s no one day to be grateful.
But that doesn’t mean today doesn’t deserve a shoutout.

To them - and the many others around us
Who enrich our lives and make this world a better place.

Thank you - and Happy Women’s Day 🌻

We are who we are. 
Because of who you are.

latestPosts.caption:
So how does your organization celebrate a colleague’s 10th work anniversary? We just put him up on a billboard in one of Mumbai’s busiest junctions 😃

But Kunal is no ordinary colleague.

From trying an acting career to working as a customer service rep and then as a relationship manager selling loans, he joined us in 2015 to lead sourcing for FAB BAG.

Soon, the company pivoted to build SUGAR Cosmetics. While Vineeta and I focused on the new brand, we asked Kunal to continue managing FAB BAG. But Kunal’s middle name is “FOMO” - and in 2017, just shy of 2 years with us, he declared he had extra bandwidth and wanted to help with SUGAR, which was gaining traction.

“But Vineeta & Mamta are making products – I’m pushing them online. What will you do?” I asked.

“Can I sell them in offline retail?” he replied.

“How? We’re an online brand.”

“I’ll figure it out. Are you okay if I spend time on this?”

“Umm... okay, sure.”

🤷🏽‍♂️🤷🏽‍♂️🤷🏽‍♂️

From then till now, we have been privy to a masterclass in belief and effort that shook up the industry and inspired thousands of people along the way. He showed up:

🔸 When we had just 4 SKUs, he took them to stores in Mumbai in a carry bag to try and place them

🔸 When we had to recover a ₹5,000 display from a recalcitrant retailer, he literally ran out of the shop with it onto the pillion of a scooter that was chased away

🔸 When locked in a rural godown with patchy network where he had gone to recover dues, he bravely proclaimed to a dozen henchmen: “Kuch karna hai toh khatam karo - nikal gaya toh baadme main guarantee hai loonga jo hoga”

Sounds filmy - and well, he can be😅

But sometimes truth is stranger than fiction.
And adrenaline is greater than fear.

And he kept showing up, year after year, to build our entire retail team of 3,000+ beauty advisors, sales officers, managers & executives - all rolling up to him.

🔥🔥🔥

For that and the 100+ ways he’s built this company, Vineeta and I will always be grateful. This company will always be fiercely loyal to those who are fiercely loyal to it - and we will walk on coals and leap over rainbows together.

Look forward to the next 10 years Sharma-ji - let’s gooo! 🚀
latestPosts.alt: Photo shared by Kaushik Mukherjee on March 01, 2025 tagging @kaushikmkj, @vineetasng, @trysugar, and @kunalrsc.

latestPosts.caption:
There is a thin line between curiosity and spirituality - but both begin with submission. A resolve to release the notions that exist within us - the biases and beliefs that make us and sometimes also break us. And it is this submission that leads to learning. 

Walking that line then is venturing into the unknown. Where you may need to close your eyes to see what’s within - and numb yourself from the daily distractions of screens and screeches - to feel. To question - only to find some of the answers within yourself and for the rest, there is the warm ray of hope that makes you want to explore - and believe that you will find the answer along the way. 

The trip to Kumbh was short. 
It was unplanned. 

In fact, it happened in the middle of a lot of uncertainty because my mother, sister, mother-in-law had all worked up a steely resolve to be a part of this once-in-144-years phenomenon - and since I had little to separate fact from fiction when it came to the dozen different narratives of the event, arrangement and experience, I decided to join them.

While I went as a tourist, I can safely say that the time spent over there - was rewarding in ways I had not expected. And I learnt that you don’t need to be religious to be curious - or spiritual. 

You just need to find a space that enables you to be vulnerable enough to let new experiences - all that you see and hear around you, seep in. And when all that you see and hear around you - is belief - submission and faith in a tomorrow that will be happier and healthier, there is a calmness you feel inside that feels too native to be unknown but too long-lost to be familiar.

Back in the city, life moves on - as it has. But I will be thankful for this chance opportunity to experience an oasis of calm in the middle of a sea of humans. 

One life. Soak in - everything. 

💫💫💫

p.s. As an aside, I am happy to report that apart from the Quench sunscreen, there’s finally a SUGAR product that has found its way into my daily routine. This new lip treatment tube thing actually works wonders on my dry lips - and the coconut variant is fairly flavor-shade-and-gender-neutral 😇

Hope you had a fabulous weekend! ✨

latestPosts.caption:
Proud of the kid - but it’s not because of what you think. 

We recently attended the Annual Athletics Meet at the elder one’s school and like last year, he joyfully sprinted to first place - but not before facing an epic last-minute challenge from his classmate (in red). 

The two of them had been pipping each other on and off during the practice sessions for weeks. And on this final day, his friend gave it his all near the end, lost balance after crossing the finish line and had a nasty fall.

At that time, I didn’t think much of it because I was very confused about which of the two actually finished first. Later, when I was watching the race video again, I noticed something that I had completely missed.

As soon as he crossed the finish line, upon realizing that his friend was on the ground, he was the first to spin around and rush back to check if he was okay and help him get up.

And that’s such a ‘W’ in upper case in my books.

🌟🌟🌟

Note to my little boy 
If he reads this sometime in the future:

“You did well today, kid. 
 Always remember that this is who you are.

 And no matter how hard you compete.
 No matter whether you win or lose.
 No matter who’s waiting to celebrate with you.
 Never forget to check in on your tribe.

 Because they were the ones with you 
 Before the race started.
 And they are the ones who will be there with you
 Long after the race is done and dusted.

 Well done.”

✨✨✨

p.s. In other news, yes - mandatory once-a-year Mummy-Daddy sprint also happened 🫣🏃‍♀️🏃‍♂️
